series_title: Lease Records of Lands or Buildings
series_description: Contractual agreements between the State and various parties conveying an estate in property for a limited period, subject to various conditions, in exchange for monetary or other types of consideration. Records include, but not limited to, related correspondence, actual signed contract, transactional documents, security reviews, facility specs (blueprints) and needs.
retention_statement: Fulfill the requirements of ORC 117.49. Retain 2 years after expiration of lease

series_description: Records documenting the maintenance and repair of agency buildings including, but not limited to, the actual request, reviews, correspondence, electronic database information, and documentation of completion.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years

series_description: Appraisals, encumbrances, fund transfers, plans, resolutions, Attorney General opinions, contracts and any other original documents related to the acquisition of real property by the State of Ohio.
retention_statement: Upon completing requirements of ORC 117.49, retain in agency until property is sold or conveyed.

series_title: Real Estate Property and Deed Records
series_description: Records and inventory of real estate and land acquisitions. Records include deeds, property surveys, property maps, other records pertinent and related to Real Property.
retention_statement: Retain for 1 year after recorded with County Auditor

series_description: All records for tangible property including, but not limited to, boilers, chillers, exhaust systems, manufacture warranties, instructions, and engineering drawings.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after asset is sold or salvaged

series_description: Used to establish descriptive information for each capital project and to update previously entered capital projects data.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by Auditor of State and audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Bid documents, ITB, RFP, RFQ or similar documents related to purchasing, construction, personnel services
series_description: All solicitation documents and electronic data records contained in the OAKS Financial Sourcing module.
retention_statement: Based on ORC 2305.06, retain 6 years after contract expires. OAKS: 3 bienna plus current year

series_description: Used to establish descriptive information about a supplier or update previously entered supplier data.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Contract Encumbrances, Procurements, Complaints to Vendors, and Related Contract Documents
series_description: Requisitions and purchase orders authorizing purchase of goods and services including quotes, contracts and other agreements, and electronic data records contained in the OAKS Financial Sourcing modules.
retention_statement: Based on ORC 2305.06, retain 6 years after contract expires. OAKS: 3 bienna plus current year

series_description: Incoming and outgoing correspondence of agency head dealing with significant aspects of the administration of their offices. Records document major activities, organizational functions, agency history, and includes information concerning agency policies, procedures, program, fiscal and personnel matters.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years

series_description: Routine correspondence pertaining to day-to-day activities of the office. Includes internal correspondence (letters, memos), correspondence from various individuals, companies, and organizations requesting information pertaining to agency and legal interpretations; requests for routine information or publications provided to the public by an agency which are answered by standard form letters, and other miscellaneous inquiries. This correspondence is informative (it does not attempt to influence agency policy).
retention_statement: Retain 1 year

series_description: Includes mailing lists, directories, rosters, and registers compiled by an agency including lists/directories of current and former employees, agency and departmental contacts, and service providers.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete, or replaced

series_description: All informal communications which convey information of temporary importance in lieu of oral communication including telephone voicemail, chats, posts, instant, and text messages, post-it notes, drafts, generic emails, social media posts, and shared departmental calendars. These communications have very little administrative value as they do not set policy, establish guidelines, define procedures, certify a transaction, or become a receipt.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value

series_description: Obsolete: Use GAR-CM-04
Official statement of the Attorney General's views on a legal question issued to state agencies that bear the signature of the Attorney General with all pertinent materials attached thereto.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative or legal value

series_description: Official statement of the Attorney General's views on a legal question prepared by Assistant Attorney General of the Opinions Section. (Therefore, an informal letter may not be described as an official statement of the Attorney General's views on the question and should not be cited as an "Attorney General opinion".)

Reference copies of state and federal legislation of interest to an agency. Inclusive of working documents in the formulation or support/opposition to the legislation, correspondence, and any other related support documentation.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value

series_description: Records used to draft agency rules, including worksheets, and recordings of public hearings, but not records that are retained in the Register of Ohio.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years after the effective date of an initial adoption, amendment, or rescission of rule

series_description: These records document legal cases involving an agency, including court records, research materials, reports, correspondence, and other related information.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after case is closed and no further appeals can be filed
disposition: Destroy. If case is dismissed without prejudice, retain one year after statute of limitations runs, then destroy

series_description: Used by state agencies to request that the Attorney General pursue collection of dollars owed to them that they have not been able to collect.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value

series_description: All documents relating to application and grant or denial of an administrative license, permit, etc. May include applications, inspection forms, testing documentation, supporting materials, and related correspondence.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year after final expiration, including all renewals, or 1 year after denial

series_description: Documents pertaining to public requests, including but not limited to the original request, correspondence between staff and requestor, redacted and un-redacted responsive records. Maintained to document compliance with public records law obligations (ORC 149.43).
retention_statement: Retain for 3 years

series_description: Records documenting service and repairs to equipment, including installation requests and maintenance orders.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year or until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Physical Inventory Records and Fixed Asset Reports
series_description: Records, reports, and other working documents which detail the annual fixed asset inventory of equipment owned or leased by an agency. Includes description and location which detail the annual fixed asset of the office. These records are compared to OAKS records to reconcile differences and used to compile an annual report.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 years or until superseded, provided audited by Auditor of State, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Records documenting an agency's incoming and outgoing physical mail and packages. Includes registered/insured mail logs, meter reports, postal reports, stamp requisitions, delivery slips, and packing lists of non-asset tagged equipment.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year

series_title: Direct Purchase Orders and Requisitions related to purchase of goods or services
series_description: Documents related to direct purchase orders, requisitions, and other documents related to purchase of goods or services.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Documents related to authorizing payment to another stage agency for goods and/or services received and serves as the basis for disbursing funds.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Bill for goods shipped or services rendered matched with purchase orders and receiving reports.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Release and Permit for Direct Purchases
series_description: Documents related to making emergency purchases of all materials, supplies, and equipment and to make direct purchases or engage in contract of a service.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Documents used to order supplies from a storeroom.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Postal Records, Registered Mail, Insured Mail Logs, and Metered Mail
series_description: Obsolete: Use GAR-OES-03
Obsolete: Use GAR-OES-03

Documentation of tagged and non-tagged assets scheduled for salvage, utilized to reconcile exceptions to physical asset inventory in OAKS. Includes Miscellaneous Surplus Property Turn-In Document form which documents asset and serial numbers, agency contact, description of items and condition of asset.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after property is disposed of.

series_description: Used to submit specification for a printing job to State Printing and to encumber the dollars needed for the job. Includes agency contact information, account, and product specification (i.e., page size, ink and color options, finishing).
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Administrative policies and procedures governing the operation, regulations, and/or procedures of an agency or program, including directives, manuals, and handbooks. Series may include executive level policies and procedures which are used by the head of an agency or executive level office and address agency-wide operations, critical agency functions, or issues of public visibility or concern.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after revised, superseded, or obsolete
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Obsolete: Use GAR-PP-01

Executive Orders, Proclamations, and copies of instructions issued by the Governor as the Chief Executive of State Government in pursuant to ORC 119.03 (G). Original on file permanently with Secretary of State.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete or replaced

series_description: Reports created by state agency staff or outside consultants concerning the management or operations of a state agency. May include executive level reports pertaining to agency wide operations, critical functions, or issues of public visibility and concern which are initiated by the head of an agency or in response to a legislative order, executive order, court order, or federal requirements.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years after revised, superseded, or obsolete
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Printed matter published by state agencies for distribution to the public. Also includes other published annual and periodic reports on agency activities.
retention_statement: Upon publication, fulfill the requirements of ORC 149.11. Destroy excess copies when no longer of administrative value.

series_description: Printed or recorded copies of public speeches given by representatives of state agencies pertaining to agency policies, programs, or issues.
retention_statement: Retain in agency for two years
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Includes news/press releases and bulletins issued by an agency informing the public about events, activities, and accomplishments.
retention_statement: Retain in agency for two years
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Includes photographs (negatives, prints, slides, transparencies, and related items) audio and video recordings documenting state agency activities and functions. Also includes any corresponding logs or indices. Does not include records scheduled according to content such as surveillance/security video or recordings of hearings/meetings.
retention_statement: Retain in agency for two years, or until information is no longer of administrative value
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Documents and advises supervisors and management status of on-going office activities to include projects, issues and events; advises supervisors of various events and issues.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year

series_description: Minutes and supporting records documenting internal policy decisions.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Official minutes, orders, and decisions of a state agency, commission, board, or council.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer. Dispose of if not transferred

series_description: Records and may include visitor badges documenting the entry and departure of employees and visitors into a State office building during and/or after office hours.
retention_statement: Retain 45 days

series_description: Obsolete: Use GAR-RPM-07
Obsolete: Use GAR-RPM-08
Form used to identify the length of time a record must be retained before final disposition. Includes record series title and description, media types, retention period, and method of disposal.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded by a revised retention schedule, or until record series is no longer maintained

series_description: Used for conducting an inventory of an agency's record series. Requests vital information to be used in determining the retention period and disposition of a record. Includes the record series title and description, location and inclusive dates of the records, volume, and media type.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded by an updated inventory or until record series is no longer created

series_description: A form identifying the type of records kept, date and department that are used to deposit, retrieve, return and destroy records stored off-site.
retention_statement: For deposits, destructions and returns, retain 2 years after transaction is completed
disposition: Destroy. For retrievals only, retain until transaction is completed (returned to storage), then destroy

series_description: Documentation certifying the destruction or transfer of records according to an approved records retention schedule. May include title of record series, inclusive dates, retention schedule number, volume of records, and method of disposal.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years

series_title: Certificate of Compliance for Agency Records Retention Schedules
series_description: Ohio Revised Code Section 149.33 requires all executive agencies to annually file the Certificate of Compliance with DAS State Records Administrator. This certificate identifies the status of the agencies records program.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years or until scanned

series_description: Vehicle title indicating state ownership of the vehicle.
retention_statement: Retain during ownership of vehicle

series_title: Motor Vehicle Registration and Purchase Documents
series_description: Records include vehicle title application, dealer invoice, power of attorney, and odometer statement.
retention_statement: Retain with the records of the application for the duration of ownership of the vehicle

series_title: Motor Vehicle Operational Files/Fleet Ohio and Cost Files/Voyager (Fuel, Maintenance, Employee Operations, etc.)
series_description: Records include retail fuel receipts, internal fuel transaction logs, vehicle long-term assignment forms, records relating to the employee operation of a state vehicle, vehicle complaints, traffic/parking citations, trip logs when required, lease agreements, purchase of parts and maintenance records. FleetOhio is a comprehensive fleet management information system that captures and retains the following information: vehicle tracking, work order processing, preventive maintenance scheduling, parts, fuel inventory, vehicle component warranty costs and motor pool management (reservations, tracking logs, Voyager reconciliation packets, etc.)
retention_statement: Retain during ownership of vehicle

series_description: Vehicle Turn-In documents reflecting condition of vehicle, vehicle transfer, donation, or salvage.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after the vehicle is disposed of.

series_description: Records include repair estimates, repair invoices, and loss notification.
retention_statement: Retain during ownership of the vehicle, and an additional 3 years after the vehicle is sold.

series_description: Obsolete: Use GAR-CM-04
Obsolete: Use GF-WV-04
Obsolete: Use GAR-V-03
Obsolete: Use GAR-V-04

Detail of entries made in OAKS to establish, transfer or correct coding, cash, allotment, or appropriations including documents justifying the change (e.g. payroll journals, budget journals, budget proposals, worksheets, projections, narratives, line item details). Includes audit reports and work papers created by agency's internal audit unit.
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 8 years.

series_description: Ohio Governor's executive budget document and related documentation published to OBM website (Blue Book).
retention_statement: Retain for 3 biennia plus current year (total 8 years) and until audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and audit resolutions issued or resolved.

series_description: Allows state agencies to establish or increase appropriation authority in special funds.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released, all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Used to transfer appropriations at the Spending Authority Code (SAC) level in the OAKS Financial Sourcing System between quarters of the fiscal year if they are within the same appropriation line item of an appropriation bill.
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 8 years

series_title: Request for Transfer of General Appropriation and Re-allotment of Quarters
series_description: Allows state agencies to transfer funds between appropriation line items. ORC 127.13
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 8 years

series_title: Refund of Expenditure Within the Biennium for Prior Year
series_description: Used to record receipts or repayment where the original payment was in error, duplicated, or made illegally. This is done within the biennium for the prior year.
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 8 years

series_description: To request Controlling Board approval of emergency expenditures for Capital Improvement Projects, purchases made without competitive selection, and transfer of Capital Improvement Funds.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years

series_description: Records include the grant application and all supporting documentation for both grantee and grantor. Includes, but not limited to, budget information, program narrative, assurances, abstracts, and supplements.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 biennia plus current year (total 8 years) and until audited by State Auditor, audit report released, and audit resolutions issued or resolved.

series_description: Records concerning federal grants to state agencies (acting as either grantee or grantor) which document the award, expenditure, and use of federal monies. This includes, but is not limited to, Notice of Award, Budget Information (SF-425), Maintenance of Effort, Financial Status Report, Federal Financial Report, program reports, monitoring and site visit reports, and payment requests.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 biennia plus current year (total 8 years) and until audited by State Auditor, audit report released, and audit resolutions issued or resolved.

series_description: Obsolete: Cost Accounting System (CAS) no longer active. Schedule may be modified to include new Enterprise Grants System.
Audit reports and work papers created by an agency's internal audit unit or similar functioning unit.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Copies of audit reports issued by State Auditor or federal government. Details of entries made in OAKS to establish, transfer or correct coding, cash, allotment, or appropriations including documents justifying the change (i.e., payroll journals, budget journals, budget proposals, worksheets, projections, narratives, line item details).
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 8 years.

series_description: Redeemed Bonds and Bond Coupons
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Bond Registers
retention_statement: Retain 10 years after final call date

series_description: Records include the Petty Cash Fund Quarterly Reports, Petty Cash Account Request Forms, Advance of Petty Cash Funds Forms, bank statements, and back-up documentation.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Cash in Treasury Detail Ledger, Cash Receipt Records & Cash Transfer, Register of Intra-Treasury
series_description: Cash in Treasury Detail Ledger, Cash Receipt Records & Cash Transfer, Register of Intra-Treasury
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Accounting Entity Description, Accounts Payable Ledger and Accounts Receivable Ledger
series_description: Accounting Entity Description, Accounts Payable Ledger and Accounts Receivable Ledger
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Balance Sheets
retention_statement: Retain 2 years

series_title: Bank Deposit Slips, Ledgers, Bank Statements, Cancelled Checks and Related Documents
series_description: Bank Deposit Slips, Ledgers, Bank Statements, Cancelled Checks and Related Documents
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Obsolete: Cost Accounting System (CAS) no longer active
Obsolete: Cost Accounting System (CAS) no longer active

series_title: CAS Reports and Inquiries by Data Classification
series_description: Obsolete: Cost Accounting System (CAS) no longer active
Used by OBM to define allocation units and be agencies to define their Spending Authority Codes (SAC's).
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Revenue Receipts and Holding Account Redistribution
series_description: Used to deposit and record revenue receipts from any known revenue source and to hold unknown receipts for redistribution. Also used by agencies which have established a departmental holding fund from which revenue is redistributed or by any agency which receives revenue from an unknown source and deposits it to a fund using the revenue source hold.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Used by State Accounting to indicate errors on documents returned to an agency site.
retention_statement: Retain until error is corrected

series_title: Request for Replacement Warrants that were Lost, Never Received or Forged/Stolen
series_description: Records or forms that include Claim for Reissuance of Voided Warrant form, Voided Warrant Certification form, Affidavit of Forgery form and related documentation submitted to the Office of Budget Management.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released, all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Form used to change information on a warrant.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value

series_title: Request for Stop or Cancellation of Warrant
series_description: Agency authorization for Stop Payment / Warrant Cancellation including Stop Payment Warrant EFT Cancellation
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: OAKS AP Vouchers, Travel Vouchers, Pcard Vouchers, Journal Vouchers, Invoices, Receipts and Attachments
series_description: Details of accounts payable transaction including documents authorizing payment of invoice for goods and/or services received. Information regarding payments made, supplier, agency, goods/services, backup documentation.
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: OAKS AR Billings, Deposit Modifications, Refund of Expenditure
series_description: Documents authorizing invoicing for goods and/or services rendered, deposits and backup documentation, (billing summaries, delinquent payment notices), receipt or repayments where the original payment was in error.
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 8 years

series_title: OAKS Purchase Order and Requisition Transactions
series_description: Requisitions and purchase orders authorizing purchase of goods and services including back up documentation including quotes, contracts and other agreements, and electronic data records contained in OAKS Financial Sourcing.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 biennia plus current year (8 years) and until audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and audit resolutions issued or resolved: Electronic: 8 years

series_title: OAKS Retired Asset Transactions and Backup Documentation
series_description: Details of retired asset transactions and documents authorizing disposal investigation results and disposal records.
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved. Electronic: 6 years

series_title: Commitment Control and General Ledger Transactions; Request for Transfer of General Appropriation and Reallotment of Quarters; Fund Appropriation Request via Director or Executive Memorandum
series_description: Commitment Control and General Ledger transactions including backup documentation (budget journals, spreadsheet uploads, and worksheets).
retention_statement: Retain until scanned in OAKS or audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and all discrepancies resolved.

series_description: Chartfield request submissions including new grant numbers, projects, department, service location, etc., justifying the request (e.g. grant notice award).
retention_statement: Retain for 3 biennia plus current year (8 years) and until audited by State Auditor, audit report is released, and audit resolutions issued or resolved. Electronic: 8 years

series_description: Obsolete: Use GP-O-09 Employee Labor Documents
Obsolete: Use GP-O-09 Employee Labor Documents

series_title: Telephone Logs, Bills and Call Records
series_description: Obsolete: Use IT-OP-07 System Users Access Records

series_title: Financial Disclosure Statements & Joint Legislative and Ethics Commission "JLEC" Statements
series_description: Official document that outlines personal sources of income, immediate family, business interest, real property, debtors and creditors, investments, gifs and travel expenses and all corresponding documents, i.e., Request for financial disclosure information and receipt thereof.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years

series_title: Employee Training Records, Workforce Development, Tuition Reimbursement and Other Education Assistance
series_description: Obsolete: Use GP-O-02 Employee Administrative Documents

series_title: Civil Rights and Title VII Files
series_description: Documents containing complaints and hearing information.
retention_statement: Retain 7 years

series_description: Affirmative Action Plans
retention_statement: Retain 2 years
disposition: Contact State Archives for review and possible transfer or destruction

series_title: Accident, Health & Safety Records, Incident Reports, OSHA Reports, etc.
series_description: Accident, Health & Safety Records, Incident Reports, OSHA Reports, etc.
retention_statement: Retain 5 years

series_description: Table of Organization, charts, graphs to organize the structure of positions within an agency.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded. The current chart will be audited by Auditor of State.

series_description: Document types in this series include, but are not limited to, Anonymous List/Layoff List (Employee file), Application Certification, Background Check, Civil Service Application, Computer/Network Access, Disability Separation Agreement, Drug Testing Acknowledgement, electronic or paper evaluations, Exit Checklist, Fraud Hotline Acknowledgement (HV66), Human Trafficking Acknowledgement, Letters/Correspondence (HR related), Licensure, Certifications, Military Leave forms, New Hire/Orientation/Policy Acknowledgements, OAKS ID form, Retirement forms, Outside Employment, Poll Workers forms, Position Descriptions (Employee file), Pre-Employment packet, Prior Service Form & Information, Promotion/HQ Change/Changes in Position Acknowledgement, Reference Checks, Resume/CV, Cover Letter, Security Access form, Separation/Acceptance letters, Statement Concerning Your Employment Not Covered by Social Security, Supplemental Employment Agreement, Supplemental Nepotism Statement (ADM 4173), Training/Education documents, Unclassified Services Explanation & Acknowledgement, Unemployment Compensation, electronic or paper Personnel Actions.
retention_statement: Retain 7 years from effective date of employee separation.

series_description: Documents associated to a job posting for a Position Number. These are not documents in an employee file. List of document types in this record series include, but are not limited to, Anonymous/Layoff List-Vacancy, Candidate Acknowledgements, Candidate Application, Candidate Correspondence, Checklist, External Recruitment , Hiring Control Approval-Vacancy, Interview Documents, Interview/Testing Schedules, Job Analysis Documents, Job Posting, Other Vacancy Documents, Position Description-Vacancy, Position Requisition, Recruitment Analyses Reports, Reference/Background/Employee History Report, Selection/Offer Approvals, Table of Organization, Test Documents.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years from effective date of employee hire-rehire or date decision not to fill the position is made.

series_description: List of document types in this record series include, but are not limited to: Accident or Illness form, American with Disabilities Act (ADA), C+84, C86, C-9, Childbirth/Adoption, DHO/SHO Orders, Disability Application, Doctor Letter for Light Duty, Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA) documents, Hospitalization/Outpatient Surgery Certification, Independent Medical Exam (IME), Injury/Illness Report (ADM 4303), Medco-14s, Medical correspondence, Medical Records, Ohio Employee Assistance Program (EAP) Agreements, Retirement Disability Application, Return to Work, Salary Continuation Request/Extension, Statement of Psychiatric Disability-Psych Questionnaire (ADM 4316), Transitional Work Program (TWP), Workers' Compensation correspondence, letters from BWC, etc.
retention_statement: Retain 7 years from effective date of employee separation.

series_description: Duties and responsibilities that detail knowledges, skills, and abilities for a position number.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, replaced or obsolete.

series_description: Records of grievances filed by an employee.
retention_statement: Retain 7 years after case is closed. (Be aware that some collective contracts specify where such documents can be kept.)

series_description: A reprimand that documents a violation of work rules or policies by an employee of the agency.
retention_statement: Retain 2 years from effective date unless an agreement has been established and no other discipline imposed during the last 2 years

series_description: Personnel Actions (electronic or paper) and attachments documenting a violation of work rules or policies resulting in a suspension.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years from effective date unless an agreement has been established and no other discipline imposed during the last 3 years

series_description: Records in this series include, but are not limited to, Inactive Discipline, Investigation documents, Memorandum of Understanding (MOU), Pattern Abuse notices, other agreements, etc.
retention_statement: Retain 7 years from effective date of employee separation.

series_description: List of document types in this record series include, but are not limited to, Benefit Enrollment/Change form, Benefit Refunds, Benefit Eligibility Appeal packet, Change of Address, Deferred Compensation, Dependent Eligibility documents, Direct Deposit form, Final Payroll Certification, Healthcare Waiver form, Insurance Enrollment form, Jury Duty-Copy of Check and Subpoena, Leave Conversion form, Over/Under Payment & Financial Settlement, Payroll Deduction Cards and Agreements, Physician Verification Notice, Request for Refunds, Tax Forms (Federal, State, City), Union Authorization Cards, Verification of Employment/Income.
retention_statement: Retain 7 years from effective date of employee separation.

series_description: Department of Homeland Security form used to verify the identity and legal authorization to work of all paid employees in the United States.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years from effective date of employee hire-rehire or 1 year from effective date of employee separation, whichever is later.

series_description: Manuals produced or attained by an agency for internal personnel training.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete, or replaced

series_description: Data collected from an electronic timekeeping system to establish payable work hours and attendance including, but not limited to, time of day employee begins and ends work on a given day, hours worked each day, and total hours worked each work week.
retention_statement: Retain until State Audit, audit report is released, all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Payroll Warrant Records and Payroll Disbursement Records
series_description: Documents created for the disbursements of payroll warrants, checks, reports, and journals providing a breakdown of employee pay and hours worked collectively and individually.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by Auditor of State, audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved
disposition: Destroy. If Federal funds are involved, retain according to appropriate Federal schedules

series_description: Temporary Personnel Contracts
retention_statement: Retain 7 years after the expiration of contracts
disposition: Destroy provided audited by Auditor of State and audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Information Resources Management and Data Processing Services Plans
series_description: Agency IT plans, data processing services plans, strategic plans, and related records used to plan for information systems development, technology acquisitions, data processing services provision, or related areas.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete or replaced
disposition: Transfer to State Archives for their possible retention or destruction. See GAR-PP-02

series_description: Records of data processing policies including those covering access and security, systems development, data retention and disposition, and data ownership.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete or replaced
disposition: Transfer to State Archives for their possible retention or destruction. See GAR-PP-02

series_title: Data Processing Product/Vendor and State Contracts Reference Files
series_description: Information on data processing equipment, software, and other products and their vendors.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by Auditor of State and audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: OGS Data Center Time Billing Records
series_description: Reports and other records from OGS detailing charges for use of the Office of General Services computer services including monthly billing reports, copies of vouchers and bills.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by Auditor of State and audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Copies of Purchase Requisitions, Orders, and Billing Records for Data Processing Services
series_description: Copies of records created to initiate the purchasing process, authorize and provide funds for, or satisfy claims and expedite payments for private service providers including copies of purchase orders, invoice requests, receipts, agency vouchers, service reports, and other supporting documentation.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by Auditor of State and audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_title: Records of Chargebacks to Data Processing Services Users
series_description: Electronic and manual records used to document, calculate costs and bill program units for computer usage and data processing services. These records are also used for cost recovery, budgeting, or administrative purposes. Records Not Covered: Chargeback records subject to Federal audit requirements should be scheduled separately.
retention_statement: Retain until audited by Auditor of State and audit report is released and all discrepancies are resolved

series_description: Records documenting support services provided to specific data processing equipment or installations including site visit reports, program and equipment service reports, service histories, and correspondence and memoranda. For service contracts, see IT-OP-03.
retention_statement: Retain site visit reports, problem and equipment service reports, and routine correspondence and memoranda until warranty or guarantee of service has expired
disposition: Destroy. Retain service histories and other summary records until the related equipment is no longer in use, then destroy

series_title: Help Desk Telephone Logs and Reports
series_description: Records used to document requests for technical assistance and responses to these requests as well as to collect information on the use of computer equipment for program delivery, security, or other purposes.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value

series_description: Memoranda, flyers, catalogues, registration forms, rosters, and other records relating to training courses run by a data processing user support or office automation support unit.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete, or replaced

series_description: Summary reports and other records created to document computer usage for reporting or other purposes.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value to agency

series_description: Records of procedures for data entry, the operation of computer equipment, production control, tape library, system backup, and other aspects of a data processing operation.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded, obsolete or replaced
disposition: Transfer to State Archives for their possible retention or destruction. See GAR-PP-02

series_description: Records documenting the use, operation, and maintenance of an agency's data processing equipment including operating manuals, hardware/operating system requirements, hardware configurations, and equipment control systems.
retention_statement: Retain until the agency no longer uses related hardware and all data is transferred to and made useable in new hardware environment

series_description: Maintenance contracts for data processing equipment, and related records including copies of contracts, service histories, and work orders.
retention_statement: For sale of goods, retain five years after contract expires
disposition: Destroy. For services, retain 16 years, then destroy. See GAR-C-03

series_title: Operating System and Hardware Conversion Plans
series_description: Records relating to the replacement of equipment or computer operating systems.
retention_statement: Retain 1 year after successful conversion

series_title: Data Processing Disaster Preparedness and Recovery Plans
series_description: Records related to the protection and reestablishment of data processing services, equipment and data (back-up files) in case of a disaster.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded by revised plan

series_description: Copies of master files or databases, application software, logs, directories, and other records needed to restore a system in case of a disaster or inadvertent destruction.
retention_statement: Retain for a minimum of 12 backup cycles

series_description: Electronic or textual records created to control or monitor individual access to a system and its data created for security purposes, including but not limited to user account records, security logs, and password files.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value to agency

series_description: Electronic files or automated logs created to monitor computer system usage including but not limited to log-in files, system usage files, data entry logs, and records of individual computer program usage.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value to agency

series_description: Summary reports and other paper records created to document computer usage.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value to agency

series_description: Records used to schedule computer runs including daily schedules, run reports, run requests, and other records documenting the successful completion of a run.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative or fiscal value to agency

series_description: Copies of records or forms designed and used solely for data input and control when the data processing unit provides centralized data input services and original records are retained by the program unit.
retention_statement: Retain until all data has been entered into the system and, if required, verified

series_description: Data generated during the creation of a master file or database used to validate a master file or database during a processing cycle.
retention_statement: Retain for a minimum of 12 database/master file backup cycles

series_description: Automated records used to control the location, maintenance, and disposition of magnetic media in a tape library.
retention_statement: Retain until related records or media are destroyed or withdrawn from the tape library

series_description: Records used to control the location, maintenance, and disposition of magnetic media in a tape library including list of holdings, control logs, and "scratch reports" regarding the destruction of tape library electronic files.
retention_statement: Retain until superseded

series_description: Records necessary for using the system: user guides, system or sub-system definitions, system flowcharts, program descriptions and documentation, job control or work flow records, system specifications, and input and output specifications.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 years after discontinuance of system and until all system data is destroyed or transferred to new operating environment
disposition: Destroy. If all data is not destroyed or transferred, transfer specifications to State Archives for their possible retention or destruction

series_description: Records generally created during development or modification and necessary to access, retrieve, manipulate and interpret data in an automated system including data element dictionary, file layout, code book or table, and other records that explain the meaning, purpose, structure, logical relationships, and origin of the data elements.
retention_statement: Retain 3 years after discontinuance of system or application and until system's or application's data is destroyed or transferred to a new structure or format
disposition: Destroy. If all data is not destroyed or transferred, transfer records to State Archives for their possible retention or destruction

series_description: Automated program code which generates the machine-language instructions used to operate an automated information system.
retention_statement: Retain for 3 system update cycles after code is superseded or replaced

series_description: Copy of program code, program flowcharts, program maintenance log, system change notices, original design documents, specifications, requirements, acceptance tests, and other records that document computer programs and the modifications made to computer programs.
retention_statement: Retain until all data in system has been migrated or destroyed. If all data is not destroyed or transferred, transfer documentation to State Archives for their possible retention or destruction.

series_description: Records used in the procurement of system hardware and software including request for proposals, proposals, quotations and bids, benchmark/acceptance testing information, correspondence, duplicate copies of contracts, purchase orders, technical reviews, and vendor information including references and literature on the firm or product line.
retention_statement: For sale of goods, retain five years
disposition: Destroy. For services, retain 16 years, then destroy. See GAR-C-01

series_description: Routine or benchmark data sets, related documentation, and test results constructed or used to test or develop a system.
retention_statement: Retain until no longer of administrative value to agency
